purpose: Vision bounding interview for GENESIS framework - transforms vague ideas into bounded system specifications

phases.name: Problem Space
phases.description: Understanding the problem being solved - must have clear answers to proceed

questions.question: What specific problem are you solving?

answerQuality.rejectionMessage: A problem statement needs to describe what happens to whom. Can you give me at least a sentence?

redFlags.message: Too vague - need a specific, concrete problem statement

followUps: Can you give me a concrete example of someone experiencing this problem?
What's the worst case scenario when this problem isn't solved?

exampleOptions.label: Communication gap
exampleOptions.description: People struggle to connect or communicate effectively

exampleOptions.label: Information access
exampleOptions.description: Critical information is hard to find or use

exampleOptions.label: Process friction
exampleOptions.description: A workflow has too many steps or is error-prone

exampleOptions.label: Underserved population
exampleOptions.description: A specific group is poorly served by existing solutions

questions.question: Who experiences this problem most acutely?

answerQuality.rejectionMessage: Please describe a specific person or group (e.g., 'elderly patients managing multiple medications').

redFlags.message: "Everyone" is not a target user - need specific characteristics

followUps: Describe a typical day in their life
What's their relationship with technology?
What constraints do they operate under?

exampleOptions.label: Specific context
exampleOptions.description: People in a particular situation or environment

exampleOptions.label: Specific need
exampleOptions.description: People with a particular capability or limitation

questions.question: How do they solve this problem today?

redFlags.message: If truly no solution exists, probe deeper - how do they cope?

followUps: What workarounds have they developed?
What existing products come closest?
Why haven't those solutions worked?

exampleOptions.label: Manual workaround
exampleOptions.description: Spreadsheets, phone calls, pen and paper

exampleOptions.label: Competitor product
exampleOptions.description: Existing tool that partially addresses it

exampleOptions.label: Hired help
exampleOptions.description: Pay someone else to handle it

exampleOptions.label: Avoidance
exampleOptions.description: They just don't do it, accepting the cost

questions.question: What's the cost of the current solution?

redFlags.message: No cost suggests weak problem - probe for hidden costs

followUps: Time cost - how much time do they spend?
Money cost - what do they pay?
Emotional cost - how does it make them feel?
Opportunity cost - what can't they do because of this?

exampleOptions.label: Time burden
exampleOptions.description: Hours per week spent on workarounds

exampleOptions.label: Missed opportunities
exampleOptions.description: Things they can't do because of the problem

questions.question: Why hasn't this been solved before? What's changed?

redFlags.message: No clear timing insight is risky - competitors may have failed for good reasons

followUps: What technology or capability is now available that wasn't before?
What market or behavioral shift has occurred?
What regulation or policy change enables this?

exampleOptions.label: New technology
exampleOptions.description: AI, mobile, cloud made it possible

exampleOptions.label: Regulatory change
exampleOptions.description: New rules enable or require this

exampleOptions.label: Cost reduction
exampleOptions.description: What was expensive is now affordable

phases.name: Solution Vision
phases.description: Understanding how the solution works - needs founder perspective

questions.question: What's your unique insight? Why will YOUR solution work when others haven't?

redFlags.message: "Better UX" is weak differentiation - need a structural advantage

followUps: What do you know that competitors don't?
What can you do that they can't?
Why would users choose you over the incumbent?

questions.question: Why are YOU the right person/team to build this?

redFlags.message: No connection to the problem is risky - probe for personal stake

followUps: Have you experienced this problem personally?
What relevant experience do you bring?
Who on your team has domain expertise?

exampleOptions.label: Professional expertise
exampleOptions.description: I've worked in this domain for years

exampleOptions.label: Network/access
exampleOptions.description: I have connections to target users

questions.question: What does success look like in 1 year?

redFlags.message: Overly ambitious - need realistic, bounded 1-year goals

followUps: How many users would indicate success?
What key behaviors would users exhibit?
What metrics would you track?

exampleOptions.label: Behavior milestone
exampleOptions.description: Users doing X with frequency Y

questions.question: What will you explicitly NOT do?

redFlags.message: No anti-scope = unfocused. Must have clear exclusions.

followUps: What features are you intentionally deferring?
What user segments are you NOT serving?
What adjacent problems are you ignoring?

exampleOptions.label: Platform exclusion
exampleOptions.description: Not building for X platform yet

exampleOptions.label: User exclusion
exampleOptions.description: Not serving X user type initially

exampleOptions.label: Feature exclusion
exampleOptions.description: Not building X capability in V1

questions.question: What's the ONE thing that MUST work for this to succeed?

redFlags.message: Multiple core features = unfocused. Force prioritization.

followUps: If everything else fails but this works, would it still be valuable?
What's the simplest version of this that would be useful?

exampleOptions.label: Critical capability
exampleOptions.description: The technical thing that enables everything

questions.question: What platforms must this work on?

patterns: web and mobile and desktop and TV
redFlags.message: All platforms is unrealistic for V1 - force prioritization

followUps: What's the primary platform?
What percentage of users are on each?

questions.question: Any regulatory or compliance requirements?

redFlags.message: Compliance mismatch detected - this is a blocker

followUps: Have you worked with these requirements before?
Do you have compliance expertise on the team?

questions.question: What's your budget constraint for V1?

redFlags.message: Unlimited budget is unrealistic - need real constraints

followUps: Monthly infrastructure budget?
Development resources (team size, time)?

questions.question: What's your timeline to MVP?

redFlags.message: No deadline = scope creep risk. Need time constraint.

followUps: Is there a hard deadline (event, funding, competitor)?
What's driving this timeline?

exampleOptions.label: External deadline
exampleOptions.description: Specific date driven by external factor

questions.question: Any existing assets, code, or infrastructure to build on?
followUps: What state is the existing code in?
Any technical debt to be aware of?

exampleOptions.label: Existing prototype
exampleOptions.description: Have a working proof of concept

exampleOptions.label: Existing product
exampleOptions.description: Adding to or rebuilding existing system

phases.name: Inspiration & Anti-Inspiration
phases.description: Understanding vision through examples and counter-examples

questions.question: What products do you admire? What specifically about them?

redFlags.message: No inspiration suggests unclear vision - probe deeper

followUps: What would you steal from each?
How do they make users feel?

questions.question: What products do you hate? What specifically about them?

redFlags.message: No anti-inspiration suggests unclear values - probe deeper

followUps: What mistakes will you NOT make?
What dark patterns will you avoid?

questions.question: Who would you consider direct and indirect competitors?

redFlags.message: No competitors is either naive or a warning sign - probe for indirect competition

followUps: Why haven't they solved this?
What's their weakness?
How would you position against them?

exampleOptions.label: Substitute
exampleOptions.description: Different solution users might choose instead

exampleOptions.label: Incumbent
exampleOptions.description: Status quo that users stick with

problem_clarity.high: Specific problem with quantified pain and clear target user
problem_clarity.medium: Problem identified but pain or target user needs refinement

solution_clarity.high: Clear unique insight, focused scope, defined anti-scope
solution_clarity.medium: Good direction but some scope ambiguity
solution_clarity.low: No clear differentiation or unfocused scope

verdicts.READY: All three criteria at High or Medium - proceed to Layer 1 analysis
verdicts.NEEDS_CLARIFICATION: One or more criteria at Low - return specific questions
verdicts.NOT_READY: Multiple Low ratings or critical red flags triggered - cannot proceed
